column2: NEBRASKA PERMIT TEST
column4: Nebraska

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 2. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column6: expect trains on any track at any time.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 3. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column4: a yield sign.

column2: 4. In work zones, fines for speeding are:
column4: doubled

column2: 5. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: protect

column2: 6. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 7. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 8. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.

column2: 9. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
10. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column10: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 11. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 12. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 13. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column10: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 14. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 15. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective red square

column2: 16. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 17. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: leave the wheels straight.
column6: turn the wheels toward the curb.
column8: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.

column2: 18. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column10: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 20. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: at the next crosswalk.
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 21. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 22. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column6: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.
column8: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column10: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.

column2: 23. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 24. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 25. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
